MathMLElement.summary: The MathMLElement interface represents any MathML element.

MathMLElementAttributeStyleMap.summary: The attributeStyleMap read-only property of the interface returns a live object that contains a list of style properties of the element that are defined in the element's inline style attribute, or assigned using the property of the interface via script.

remarks.para: Shorthand properties are expanded. If you set border-top: 1px solid black, the longhand properties (border-top-color, border-top-style, and border-top-width) are set instead.
The main difference between property and attributeStyleMap property is that, the style property will return a object, while the attributeStyleMap property will return a object.
Though the property itself is not writable, you could read and write inline styles through the object that it returns, just like through the object that returns via the style property.

MathMLElementAutofocus.summary: The autofocus property of the interface contains a boolean value reflecting the autofocus HTML global attribute. It indicates whether the MathML element should be focused when the page loads or when the element becomes shown if the MathML element is inside a dialog or a popover.

MathMLElementBlur.summary: The blur() method of the interface removes keyboard focus from the current MathML element.

MathMLElementDataset.summary: The dataset read-only property of the interface provides read/write access to custom data attributes (data-*) on elements. It exposes a map of strings () with an entry for each data-* attribute.

remarks.para: The dataset property itself can be read, but not directly written. Instead, all writes must be to the individual properties within the dataset, which in turn represent the data attributes.

MathMLElementFocus.summary: The focus() method of the interface sets focus on the specified MathML element, if it can be focused. The focused element is the element that will receive keyboard and similar events by default.

remarks.para: By default the browser will scroll the element into view after focusing it, and it may also provide visible indication of the focused element (typically by displaying a "focus ring" around the element). Parameter options are provided to disable the default scrolling and force visible indication on elements. If you call focus() from a mousedown event handler, you must call event.preventDefault() to keep the focus from leaving the MathMLElement.

MathMLElementStyle.summary:
The read-only style property of the interface returns the inline style of an element in the form of a live object.
This object can be used to get and set the inline styles of an element.
MathMLElementStyle.value:
A live object.
NOTEEarlier versions of the specification returned a (from which is derived).
See the browser compatibility table for browser support information.Although the style property itself is read-only in the sense that you can't replace the CSSStyleProperties object, you can still assign to the style property directly, which is equivalent to assigning to its property. You can also modify the CSSStyleProperties object using the and methods.

MathMLElementTabIndex.summary: The tabIndex property of the interface represents the tab order of the current MathML element.

remarks.para: Elements that are disabled do not participate in the tabbing order. Values don't need to be sequential, nor must they begin with any particular value. They may even be negative, though each browser trims very large values.
